title: Nigel Roy
text:
Nigel Roy is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a and in the s in the 1990s and 2000s.
He played for <a href="Illawarra%20Steelers">Illawarra</a>, <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney</a>, <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a> and the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a>.
Early life.
Roy was born 15 March 1974 in <a href="Lismore%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Lismore</a>, <a href="New%20South%20Wales%2C%20Australia">New South Wales, Australia</a>.
He commenced his football playing in the junior teams in <a href="Kyogle">Kyogle</a>.
Playing career.
Roy made his first grade debut for Illawarra in round 10 1993 against <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland</a> at <a href="WIN%20Stadium">WIN Stadium</a> which ended in a 30-0 victory. Roy departed Illawarra at the end of 1994 and signed with North Sydney.
While at the North Sydney Bears, Roy played finals in 4 out of 5 seasons at the club and was a member of the Norths side which made consecutive preliminary finals in 1996 & 1997. In 2000, North Sydney merged with arch rivals Manly-Warringah to form the <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a>. Roy was one of the few players from Norths signed on to play for the new team. In 2001, Roy joined London and played with the club up until the end of 2004 before retiring.
